long:
Meaning: to "pull off"; hence (intensively) to "strip", (reflex.) to "depart"; by implication, to "deliver", "equip" (for fight); "present", "strengthen".
Usage: arm (self), (go, ready) armed (Ã— man, soldier), deliver, draw out, make fat, loose, (ready) prepared, put off, take away, withdraw self.
Source: a primitive root;
